What does a gimbal do for your phone?

Simply put, a gimbal stabilizes your smartphone so your video footage looks smooth and shake-free. Instead of struggling with jittery or blurry videos, a gimbal uses motors and sensors to automatically compensate for your hand movements as you walk, pan, or tilt your phone. As a result, creators, vloggers, and even everyday users can achieve cinematic-quality video, making gimbals an essential accessory for anyone looking to level up their mobile filming.

What is the difference between a gimbal and a stabilizer?

While the terms are sometimes used interchangeably, there is an important distinction. A gimbal is actually a type of stabilizer. However, it uses electronic motors and sensors to actively counteract hand shake and sudden movements. In contrast, a regular stabilizer‚Äîsuch as a handheld rig or counterweight‚Äîrelies purely on mechanical balance to reduce motion. Therefore, gimbals not only provide superior stabilization, but also unlock advanced features like automatic tracking and gesture controls, which many traditional stabilizers cannot offer.

Is a gimbal better than a tripod?

The answer depends on your shooting style. On one hand, a tripod is perfect when you want your phone to remain absolutely still. This is ideal for group photos or time-lapse shots. On the other hand, a gimbal is designed to keep your video steady while you‚Äôre moving. This makes it the best choice for filming on the go, vlogging, or capturing action scenes. In fact, many of the best smartphone gimbals for 2025 even include a built-in tripod mode. This allows you to switch between dynamic and stationary filming as needed seamlessly.
